Add a shadow shifted column to a dataset

Shifting the values of a numeric

add_shadow_shift(data, vars, suffix = "shift")

Arguments

data

data.frame or .tbl
vars

quoted variables that you want to shift
suffix

suffix to add to variable, defaults to "shift"

Value

.data with the added variable shifted named as `var_suffix`

Examples


add_shadow_shift(pedestrian, vars = "hourly_counts")
#> # A tibble: 37,700 x 10
#>    hourly_counts           date_time  year   month month_day week_day  hour
#>            <int>              <dttm> <int>   <ord>     <int>    <ord> <int>
#>  1           883 2016-01-01 00:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     0
#>  2           597 2016-01-01 01:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     1
#>  3           294 2016-01-01 02:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     2
#>  4           183 2016-01-01 03:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     3
#>  5           118 2016-01-01 04:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     4
#>  6            68 2016-01-01 05:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     5
#>  7            47 2016-01-01 06:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     6
#>  8            52 2016-01-01 07:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     7
#>  9           120 2016-01-01 08:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     8
#> 10           333 2016-01-01 09:00:00  2016 January         1   Friday     9
#> # ... with 37,690 more rows, and 3 more variables: sensor_id <int>,
#> #   sensor_name <chr>, hourly_counts_shift <dbl>
add_shadow_shift(airquality, vars = c("Ozone", "Solar.R"))
#> # A tibble: 153 x 8
#>    Ozone Solar.R  Wind  Temp Month   Day Ozone_shift Solar.R_shift
#>    <int>   <int> <dbl> <int> <int> <int>       <dbl>         <dbl>
#>  1    41     190   7.4    67     5     1    41.00000     190.00000
#>  2    36     118   8.0    72     5     2    36.00000     118.00000
#>  3    12     149  12.6    74     5     3    12.00000     149.00000
#>  4    18     313  11.5    62     5     4    18.00000     313.00000
#>  5    NA      NA  14.3    56     5     5   -15.04422     -31.30393
#>  6    28      NA  14.9    66     5     6    28.00000     -27.84602
#>  7    23     299   8.6    65     5     7    23.00000     299.00000
#>  8    19      99  13.8    59     5     8    19.00000      99.00000
#>  9     8      19  20.1    61     5     9     8.00000      19.00000
#> 10    NA     194   8.6    69     5    10   -13.14288     194.00000
#> # ... with 143 more rows
